headline: Grilled Rock Lobster Tails
description: This rock lobster tail recipe for the grill features a flavorful marinade of garlic, paprika, bright lemon, and olive oil and cooks in just 10 minutes.

video.description: Watch how to grill rock lobster tails!
video.name: Grilled Rock Lobster Tails

name: Grilled Rock Lobster Tails

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the grill for high heat and lightly oil the grates.
Pour lemon juice into a small bowl; slowly whisk in olive oil. Whisk in salt, paprika, white pepper, and garlic powder until combined.
Split lobster tails lengthwise with a large knife, then brush flesh with some marinade.

Place lobster tails flesh-side down on the preheated grill and cook, turning once and basting frequently with marinade, until opaque and firm to the touch, 10 to 12 minutes. Discard any remaining marinade.

review.reviewBody: First off, thank you for not telling us your life story prior to hitting us up with the ingredients. Yeesh, talk about a pet peeve. Straight to business here.. I like it! As far as the food, the lobster came out delicious! I've done this several times now, and it's a great recipe.
awesome, easy and delicious!
This had to be the BEST lobster tail I've ever had...Basic and delicious!!!

1/2 the salt
green egg 450F
10-12 minutes for good size tails
First time cooking lobster tails at home and it was amazing. Will absolutely be using this recipe again. #allamericangrilling
It was great. Easy to make.

This was my first time grilling lobster so I was intent on following the recipe. The result was tasty however the meat was very difficult to remove. I attribute this to over cooking the tails. 10 minutes is, obviously, too long. Unfortunate since lobster is a bit pricey to experiment with.
This was a simple delicious recipe that really showcased the lobster! Awesome !

I have made this twice, and it will be my go to recipe. I cut the tails in half completely so they cook from top to bottom. the first time I left them attached at the bottom and had a bit of trouble maneuvering them on the grill. It was easier when I cut them clear through. the marinade is great and they looked fantastic.

We thought they were very good. I grilled tails between 5 to 6 ounces. Basted them with butter. Started away from the heat and then moved them over the flame. I grilled them until the shell turned red. Perfect built in thermometer. 

I also grilled a skewer of shrimp. Shells off 13 to 15 count. Just basted with butter. Grilled perfectly. I grilled until they appeared done. I did not time. Served with a salad of home grown lettuce a so called cleopatra dressing with pieces of fried bacon. 

Will definitely do this meal again.

We’ve never grilled lobster before but with an easy recipe like this, how could we not try it? Followed recipe nearly exactly, save for cutting back on the oil a bit because we had 6oz tails. Cooked them on a grill mat. Delicious! These are being added to the rotation!

I am not even a big fan of Lobster, but this has become our "special dinner" followed recipe exactly, as others have said, kind of butterfly the lobster for cooking all the way through and do like 3-4 min each side, till meat is white, starting with meat side down. Baste baste baste!! the more you baste the better it will taste!
Grilling them was a great idea, this recipe was easy to follow and the results were finger licking good!

Great Recipe. I grilled mine slightly differently by using direct and indirect heat. Place your coals to one side of the grill. I baste the lobster tails and grill, flesh down over the coal for 2-3 minutes. Then I flip them to the shell side off to the non-coal side for indirect heating. Baste them again and close the grill lid and allow to cook for another 5-6 minutes until the shells are red the the tail flesh is white and slightly firm. Remove from the grill and baste them one last time.
LOVED the flavor!!! and very easy!!!
my bro-inlaw would not eat lobster until he had these I made. Now its all he talks about ;-)
Made this for my wife’s first time trying lobster. She loved it and defiantly wants me to make it again. Thank you for posting this.
Made these on a salt slab and they were fantastic! Did not change a thing!

OMG. This recipe is amazing. I will never pay for lobster after eating this recipe. I made it for Valentine’s Day dinner and it made for a great touch to go with the bone in ribeye. I always thought was is the big deal about lobster tail, crab legs are better. Now I know I had not eaten good Lobster. I’ll never go back.
Didn’t have white pepper, so I used black. It was really good!
A big hit for Christmas Eve.
Great way to enjoy any kind of lobster! Will use this recipe again and again!
It was wonderful
Came out great, my friends were delighted
I will be Definitely making this recipe again. I used actually frozen lobster tail from January and you could not tell that they had been frozen that long. They were excellent!!!!!
Great recipe, and easy. I thought it was a bit salty, so next time I'll cut the salt in half.

This is absolutely the BEST recipe ever!! I BBQ lobster for the 1st time yesterday , found this recipe in a clutch and chile... it did NOT disappoint. I tasted the recipe as written and decided it needed just a little bit more to suit my taste. I added 1 tsp of onion powder, 1 tsp of Tony Chachere's, 1 tsp of Old Bay seasoning , and 1 tsp of lemon pepper seasoning to the mix to jazz it up. The base mix with my add on's made it BEYOND memorable. This is a great marinade for lobster, going to try this again using fish!! 15 min and basting on both sides and they came out PERFECT!!
Definitely would make it again!holy hek
Turned out amazing! Made these for my boyfriend's birthday and received so many compliments!
Hey It's Lobster! Who doesn't love Lobster? A friend used a variation with cilantro and I didn't much care for it! Stick with the original recipe!
So easy - followed recipe exactly and it was great!
Followed this recipe exactly, delicious! Thank you!
Made exactly as is except took tails out of shell and husband thought they were the best tails ever.
It was perfect , super delish !!!
it was perfectly cooked, but i had issues with the shell. but no big deal.
Made it just as it states in the recipe, everyone loved the lobster
Followed the recipe exactly as written. Marinade is just perfect for lobster tails. Thank you very much.
Made this for Father’s Day, absolutely delicious!

Next time I’ll buy more lobster tails. My kids ate these without sharing. The flavor was so delicious. I love simple recipes and this one does not disappoint. I can’t wait to grill some later in the summer for a family get together.
Made it exactly as written. Cooked 12 minutes. Cut open front and back so it was easy to marinate. Absolute best lobster we have ever tasted!! So easy! Who knew!
I like lobster, Mari loves them. Bought two tails at Kroger for $8 ea good deal. We were surprised at how much meat there was. Cooked them on the grill along with wild Atlantic shrimp, delicious.
Great on the grill or in the steamer!
Really good!! BBQ’d see pic. Thank you!!!

First time attempting Lobster. Delicious! Used a grill top pan, only used butter, parsley and garlic salt for basting and it came out perfect. Cooked a little longer than 12 minutes. Started with the meat side down, grilled 7 minutes and turned to shell side for about 10 minutes, which allowed easy detachment of the shell and not overcooked.

This is my go-to recipe for lobster. I usually add a little bit of extra lemon as a personal preference. Drizzle this stuff over lobster and let it sit for about 30 minutes, throw it on a grill at 300f and cook each side for 4 or 5 minutes.

It was very simple to prepare and delicious! I did these on a stove-top griddle grill. I used kitchen shears to cut the shell and part way through lobster flesh. Brushed marinade on flesh and cooked flesh side down and then brushed on shell. Made sure to gently press flesh down for contact with griddle grill. Flipped to back of shell to gently cook lobster and then back again. Kept using some marinade to baste while cooking. Lobster easily came out of shell and didn't need butter. Used extra marinade to cook Tilapia filets as well! All were delicious!
I followed the ingredients exactly but used 5 lobster tails and cooked on a gas top stove in a cast iron grill pan. This was excellent!!!! Will diffinately make again.

I had to doctor this recipe a bit! I added 2 or 3 pats of butter, Italian season, fresh garlic and a few shakes of Ole Bay! I also used the juice from a while small lemon! It was sooo good! I should have brought more lobster tails!!!

It was easy and delicious! Both my husband and 14yo son loved it! This recipe has definitely been added to my rotation. My family has already asked me to make it again and I just made it for the first time last week!

followed the recipe to a T, I heated the grill, but cooked the lobster on the side without the flames. Turned out awesome. After reading other reviews, I wouldn't believe that you didn't need butter, so I had it ready to go, when the lobster came off the grill....But, like others wrote, NO butter needed, Tasty as it can be. :)

It was good, not as good as with garlic butter but depends if u want to b health conscious or not. I didn't understand whether to cut the shell from the bottom of top. For my oven recipes the tail is split down the back (top). I ended up splitting from the top flipping it a couple of times. It need the full 12 minutes as the top inside wasn't fully cooked.at 9 min.
Very tasty.
First time and everyone loved it. Let the tails sit in the marinate for 30 minutes before placing on grill
Excellent. It was simple, quick and delicious.
Wife LOVES lobster! Great for our date night at home with no kids!

I mixed it just the like the recipe shows and we loved it! I agree with KARPOWELL that is doesn't need to cook for 12 minutes on the grill. Mine took about 10 minutes tops. But the marinade is so fast and easy to make and tastes great! Gives the lobster a nice little spice without over powering it. I will definitely use this recipe over and over again. I'm gonna try it on some shrimp for the grill next time. Thanks for sharing your recipe with us! :D

Made the "sauce" almost exactly as written, but subbed a little butter in for part of the oil. This sauce is amazing, and is obviously what makes this recipe work. I used smaller (cheaper) tails, but made all the sauce. Used it to marinade the tails shortly before grilling and it was perfect to bring the meal together by dribbling some over the finished steak and asparagus. I cooked my tails just under 10 minutes and basted them very frequently...You cannot walk away from the grill while these are on. They turned out great! My daughter devoured her portion, and my wife said it was the best lobster she ever had (pretty good for $5 tails).
I went to the beach. Everybody there had matching towels. Somebody went under the dock and there they found a rock. But it wasn't a rock, it was a....
Made this just as described, although my lobster tails were much smaller. Grilled three 4-5 ounce tails- they were done quickly and tasted delicious. Keeping this in my recipe box!
I followed the recipe for the marinade. I grilled 4- 3 oz. tails over charcoal with the hood down. I grilled for 10 mins and they were done.
simply perfect!
Simple, quick, and delicious. Suggest using onion powder instead of garlic powder. My clients prefer foods without the heavy use of garlic because of the breath odor garlic leaves
Fantastic! I also added some Old Bay Spice.
No changes. Simple and delicious. I will definitely make this recipe again.
Traded unsalted butter for the olive oil. Delectable.
What a fantastic marinade!
Made it;yes excellent; will make again!
This was absolutely delicious! My family loved it and we didn't even need butter for the lobster. Definitely making again and again!

All I can say is melt in your mouth. I was very shocked at how well this tasted. You do not need butter and I always have to use butter on my lobster. We have used this several times now and will use it forever!

A friend came to visit from Wisconsin and I grilled Lobster Tails and Shrimp. I used the same marinade on the shrimp. Our dinner was fantastic and I didn't change a thing on the recipe. A defiant do again..
This turned out really good. Cooking times vary depending on size of lobster, so using a food thermometer is helpful. Internal temperature of at least 140° is recommended. Will cook this again.

We had 4 Maine lobsters tails, 5 oz each. I followed the recipe exactly, adjusted for size.. We did 3 minutes on each side ofthe 
very hot gas grill and baisted liberally. The timing was perfect and the marinade was subtle but involved. We had a porterhouse on the grill as a side dish with veggies. Awesome.
I use this marinade all the time. I think tails done this way is better than Red Lobster.
Amazing and so simple. Thanks for sharing
So good! This is a keeper!

My fault most of it tasted like burnt hair, but the parts that didn't tasted amazing. Highly recommend wrapping them in foil if doing over an open flame. The hairs on the underside of the lobster tail taste and smell like our hair when it's burnt
First time we ever did lobster on the grill and it was perfect and so easy! However did need a little extra cooking time. I think we have now found our new Christmas dinner

A few notes:
1. Prep time was 5 minutes including ransacking my pantry for the ingredients.
2. Skip the paprika - its not needed
3. Double the pepper
4. Cut the shells back and front but don't cut the meat.
5. 5-6 minutes on one side, flip and 2 more minutes. 

10 minutes is more like shoe leather. And 5 is better than 6 for the 1st stage.

I have never cooked or grilled any type of sea food before because I don't personally like it. However at a friend's BBQ last night, no one else knew how to grill lobster after they purchased it. I searched for a recipe and came across this one. I have never received so many great compliments about something. This recipe was perfect! I did not have any lemon or white pepper so I omitted those and added melted butter while the lobster was on the grill to keep them moist. I will definitely use this recipe from now on!

Just made this for Valentine's Day dinner for my girlfriend and I...it turned out AMAZING. I used a charcoal grill and it gave it great flavor. This is the first time I've ever made lobster and I can't say I've had better in a restaurant. I will be using this recipe every time I make lobster now.
Great recipe if you DON’T ADD SALT! The lobsters are salty already. You can put chopped parsley on top before sprinkling the marinade. Then 12’ broiling is perfect for both lobster and parsley.
Fast, easy and DELICIOUS!
Because I have used 6 split lobster tails at a time , I put the marinade in a large Ziploc bag and toss . I have also added other herbs like dried basil, rosemary or dill weed.
Great marinade/dressing but don't overcook! 3 min per side is ample!!
Excellent, but be careful when cooking it. The oil (I'm assuming) flared up and my husband's eyebrows were singed when he put it on the grill.
Made this tonight for hubby (I can't eat shell fish) He gave it a 10!! only change used half the olive oil.

I have never been a big fan of lobster. It always seem like an overpriced vessel for butter. So after going on a diet there were only certain foods I could have and I thought I'd give lobster a try, and this recipe was fantastic. I followed it to the "t" and the results were absolutely delicious. My kids even loved it and they won't eat any kind of seafood. Great recipe, thanks for the upload! Just a side note, I put a little honey on some before cooking once and it was great too. I just mixed about a tablespoon of honey with the olive oil and it turned out great too. We'll have it either way, this recipe is great without any modifications.
I made this with shrimp also and its really good, it tastes kinda like lobster, but i used half butter, and oil

10 to 12 minutes is far too long under a high grill. Around 6 or 7 minutes (turned once) is about right. 
Listen to it - when it sizzles, it is time to turn it. When it sizzles again, it is time to serve it.

10 to 12 minutes is far too long under a high grill. Around 6 or 7 minutes (turned once) is about right. 
Listen to it - when it sizzles, it is time to turn it. When it sizzles again, it is time to serve it.
One of the best recipes I have ever done on the site.

5 stars for sure. Absolutely delicious. Followed the directions exactly, took almost 10 minutes to cook. Finger-licking good. As others have stated, butter wasn't required. I'm not overly fond of lobster but if I see them on sale at the store again I'll be buying them. Thanks for posting the recipe, Joe!

I always cruise right by the meat department lobster tails however this one day they had the mini lobster tails on clearance so I bought a package of 2 mini lobster tails came home and found this recipe. What a wonderful recipe plus I grilled up some steaks for the perfect surf & turf dinner ... My love loved them! He makes it so much fun to cook for!!!
I've made this recipe many times... it's quick, it's easy, and delicious!

Perfect. Made it on our lava rock grill. I did add some herbs from our window garden - oregano, basil, thyme and rosemary. It came out moist and tender. Just make sure to keep basting it and not to over cook the tail or it will get rubbery.

This is really a simple recipe. So I thought no brainer... But maybe my taste buds are unusual but this had little to no flavor & once the meat was removed from the shell it was done in certain areas but not all. Couldn't throw it all out but should have. Wasted a lot of money.
Was expecting the tails to have a better flavor than they did. The shrimp I made out classed them. Very disappointed especially for how much the tails cost.
Tasted so good that I didn't miss the butter I am allergic to
Absolutely delicious!
